results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Spread your wings: making it with TAFE
results.creator_credit: John O'Shea, Chris Stewart, Technical and Further Education and Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film which is intended to provide information about the opportunities offered by Technical and Further Education in vocational training, and in recreational courses to meet community requirements. It is not intended to give detailed information on the breadth of courses and curricula but is rather a stimulus film aimed at encouraging enrolment.

results.title: Evaluation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Depicts a school that takes its evaluation seriously. Keeping in touch with its community has required constant monitoring and some innovative adjustments. Staff, curriculum, in service and Supplementary Grants meetings are now one and the same and are occasions where parents and teachers learn together.

results.title: The Man on the beat
results.creator_credit: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The duties and training of a London policeman, known over the world for his courtesy. The London policeman is unarmed, and his duties vary from finding lost children to directing traffic. Dealing with crime is only an occasional part of the ordinary London policeman’s job.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films

results.title: Listen to a city
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A sophisticated view of Melbourne taking in its gardens, shops, theatres, restaurants, nightclubs and discotheques. Sporting activities include a race meeting, a football match, and water sports. Highlights Melbourne’s annual Moombe Festival and includes scenes at Montsalvat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound

results.title: Light play: black-white-gray = Ein lightspiel: scwarz-weiss-grau
results.brief_description: Moholy-Nagy, an exponent of modern design in architecture, painting, theatre and typography, illustrates the forms and relationships of his constructivist art. Constructions of steel, glass and wire, including the artist’s light-space modulator, move, merge and dissolve to produce a world of interrelated shapes and patterns. Surface textures, spatial tensions and shadows are combined with the resources of the film cameras - super- impositions, positive-negative contrasts and trick effects to produce rhythms in light, shade, space and movement.
